Header: President participates in event at Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya premises (Watch video)
Content: The National “Aluth Sahal Mangalya” was presided over by President Maithripala Sirisena at the premises of the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya in Anuradhapura on Saturday. Speaking at the event, the President stated that the government will introduce a framework to financially strengthen the agrarian community. The first portion of rice from the harvest reaped from the Maha Season was offered to the Jaya Sri Mahabodhi and the ceremony was organised by the Venerable Pallegama Srinivasa Thero. The traditional ceremony is aimed at blessing the country and the nation as well as making the country self-sufficient in rice. The leader of the indigenous community and his tribe were also present during this ceremony. During the event the President presented a bowl of organically grown rice,  free of pesticides, to the Maha Sangha. The President also distributed seed paddy for the cultivation of this form of rice in  the nine provinces.
